  • Method Details

    • receiveAsync

      public static void receiveAsync​(java.net.DatagramSocket datagramSocket, int maxMessageSize, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.function.Function<java.util.List<java.io.Serializable>,​java.io.Serializable>> callbacks) throws java.io.IOException
      receiveAsync uses a datagramSocket to receiving message then callbacks to handle requests

      The expected implementation of this method is to use the callbacks to specify the server's response to requests. The key of callbacks is the function number and specifies which function was requested. The value of callbacks is the function to be called. For a function with one argument, the callback will be called with a list of length one. For void functions, the callback should return AckMessage.

      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - The socket used for receiving.
      maxMessageSize - The maximum number of bytes for a message.
      callbacks - The function number mapped to the sever callback function.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - IOException is thrown if the server fails to receive or bind to the port.
      See Also:
      AckMessage

    • handleMessage

      private static void handleMessage​(java.net.InetAddress inetAddress, int port, byte[] data, java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,​java.util.function.Function<java.util.List<java.io.Serializable>,​java.io.Serializable>> callbacks)
      handleMessage deserialize the request then uses the callback to determine the response. The responses is response a sent back on a different socket.
      Parameters:
      inetAddress - The inetAddress of the request sender.
      port - The port of the request sender.
      data - The data from the request.
      callbacks - The callback functions.
